tangle.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to become twisted together, or make something become twisted together, in an untidy mass
tangle.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: His parachute became tangled in the wheels of the plane.
tangle.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to argue or fight with someone
tangle.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: It was not an animal youâ€™d care to tangle with.
tangle.translation[1].definitions[0].def: a twisted mass of something such as hair or thread
tangle.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Her hair was full of tangles after being out in the wind.
She followed him, pushing through the dense tangle of bushes and branches.
John was sitting on the floor in a tangle of blankets.
tangle.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: Her brain was teeming with a whole tangle of emotions.
tangle.translation[1].definitions[2].exa: She got into a tangle with the staff.
